reviews.review_msg: If your taking this to get a writing credit, take something else. she doesnt teach anything. you read essays between class and talk about them during class, then your handed an assignment with no guidance on how to do it the way she wants it. Could be a real easy class if your a natural great writer. If not, take another class for the W credit
Her Travel Lit class was imaginative and brilliant.  She is at her best when engaging with new material (not Burns), which she does far more than most S.F.U. profs.
She is a fair marker, but overall, her lectures and tutorials were pretty boring.. The essay topics she gave were uninteresting as well.
Clear lectures, and likes to get class involved. Not too hard, but not too soft.
omg I can't stay awake in this class. I'm sorry but all she really does is give background info on what we've read. it doesn't help us write the essay.

She's a nice lady, but beware:  She is a hard marker.  Also when you ask her a question during lecture she doesn't directly answer it, she basically just asks you the same question back through a prompt and have you come up with the answer yourself.

Christine seems like a nice lady, but since it's the TA's that mark our papers, I'm not really sure what kind of a marker she is. It's not necessary to go to lecture, as long as you keep up with what you need to know for tutorial. Not a bad class!

Material is boring, and the TA's were of no help and marked unjust. She rambles on, never lets you leave on time for ur next class. Disorganized notes and time preparation. I learnt everything in this course on my own and did well.
She is very confusing and the TA's don't help much.  She rambles and a lot of reading.
HARD!
No Comments
No Comments

SUCH A GOOD GUY!!!! I love him, he's so kind, caring, and intelligent. He is very open minded, and is always willing to lend a helping hand. He's truly one of the best profs that SFU has and I wish I could take more classes with him! Highly highly recommend!

Haha this class was sort of a joke. But St. Pierre was great. Even though the class was absolutely not mandatory.. I found myself wanting to attend just to see what he would come up with next. Very interesting course content. I loved learning about it. But I found the tutorials way more helpful than his lectures. But he was alright!
Such a nice guy, love him!

I love this class and this professor! I only chose this class because there were literally no other options open, but I am *so* glad I did. Interesting topics, eclectic way of teaching, unconventional assignments. You will never have a professor like Professor St Pierre, and no I'm not his hired PR, haha. If you can, take him!
Interesting course. Very different. Paul's a good guy that is very willing to help, and always accepts creativity and new ideas. Recommend this class will him as the prof for sure.

One of the best English profs I've ever had in my life. I hated English and it was my 2nd language, but he spent extra time with me improving my writing skills and told me how to selectively read his assigned readings so that I won't die. Curved my final exam even though I didn't finish everything in the allotted time.
Michelle Levy didn't touch upon anything we didn't learn in English 12. She was too set in her opinion and didn't take into consideration other students' opinions.

A lot of people reviewing Dr. Burnham give poor reviews because of the difficulty of his subject matter. I agree, it is difficult - but it is also rewarding and is an enticing look at what school will be like when we get past the "literature appreciation" undergraduate phase. I owe to him my interest in theory that I wouldn't have seen otherwise.

Absolutely ridiculously difficult for a first year English course. Extremely unclear parameters for assignments. Applying Lacanian terms in the ways that he wants to the reading material is a virtually impossible task.

It's true. He is all about Lacan, and if he is your TA he is a super hard marker. My writing probably tangibly improved because of him, and I loved all of the readings, but I was really not into the Lacan. Also, he makes you follow him on twitter.Pretty helpful one on one.

Terrible choice to take this class. Only take it if you are interested in the subject, because it is so boring. Lectures were miserably boring and the content was so bizarre and pointless. If you are taking an engl course as a requirement for another field, do not take this one. Take anything else. Not this one!
WWJD, "What would Jon do?" I ask myself this before every major and minor events of my day. Jon truly is the wind beneath my winds. Beneath all of our winds....

ENGL 104 studies nonfiction, so if you hate nonfiction, don't take it.  I'm enjoyed this english class because it taught me new skills and I learned a lot of interesting things.  Attend all the tutorials cause they're worth a chunk of your mark. One tip: note down all the quotes and significance he talks about cause they'll be in the final.
extremely hard marker, worked hard in this class had a decent mark going into final, studied like crazy and final was ridiculously hard.
Highly engaging and passionate instructor. Quite a heavy work load and a fairly difficult final, but a great professor.

A great prof! I think time management is essential for this course, as there are 5 essays, 1 paper, 1 group project, and quite a bit of reading. It might be difficult for some people, but if you work hard enough, you'll learn to appreciate English a lot more AND be able to improve your writing!
Extremely knowledgeable but a bit too opinionated at times.
She's absolutely evil
unclear, very boring, unapproachable prof
very detailed and interesting topics covered
Tests and assignments were extremely fair. Really prepared you for the exam. Good course to take for a first year student. Very approachable person.
She's good at leading tutorials. I like the books she chose.

Sophie must have read all the comments below or something, because she doesn't say "umm" all the time, she's figured out the multimedia, and her classes were very interesting.  Her enthusiasm was infectious.  The only thing I would have liked would be more depth.

Lecures are exhausting. She rarely posts the notes before class & speaks VERY fast. I agree with the ummmm thing & watching her walk back and forth infront of the class made me busy. Reading were interesting those and so was the assignment. Just not the best prof I've had.
No Comments

she's not great AT ALL in a large classroom setting, but i had her for my tutorial leader, and she's great in a small room setting.  thinks of really neat, quirky activities to get the students into the reading material.  take her seminar courses!

So... UMMMMMMMM...  she says that about 200 times a lecture (not even kidding, people counted!) NOT a very good speaker, I avoid lecture just so I don't have to listen to her talk, the class is crap too.  nothing good to say about any of it.
He has pretty good notes which provide you with the basics you need to write the papers. His lectures can be quite boring, but the powerpoint slides tell it all.
Really great, yes a bit monotone, but he is fair and helpful.

Good prof. Material is intersting but lectures are VERY boring. No point to go to lecture. Tutorials are very helpful/where u get your marks. Prof is monotone but a very nice guy and easy going. Final exam/paper grading=VERY fair!
This class rocked. The prof's note were all you needed and he was very helpful during office hours. i would take another class with this prof anyday.... best class thus far
Classes are boring , not able to explain some of the materials , question and answers are off topic , leaves a generally broad feeling of answers
text is useless, material is irrelevant to course description, and he once " assaulted students by throwing an orange at the lecturees"
